author: Matthew NPC

text: MM10 has grown on me but I think that the soundtrack is still underwhelming. Of the three tracks that have been featured on this roundup, two have been played (Wily's Castle 1 and Sheep Man). The only other one I think is truly great is Strike Man.

text: This game's soundtrack was decent at best when I first listened to it.  It does not even compare to the 8-bit soundtracks imo.  Still ashamed that this once proud franchise is no longer alive.

text: What about Mighty No. 9? You excited for that game?
author: Medal Melodies

text: Yeah I'm definintely excited for Might No. 9, seeing as Inafune and a great team is behind it. I hope it's more than just a Mega Man clone though, but I haven't really followed the project in a while.
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky From what Inafune has said it's going to be different, but I don't know exactly how. Some of the stuff they've mentioned seems like it will be more of an evolution of what Megaman would/could be, like the jump from original to X, but a bit more drastic. I think it'll be good though. :D

text: Mighty Number 9? More Mighty Piece of Turd, am I right?
author: Bartosz Skorupa

text: Not nearly my favorite soundtrack in the franchise, but some of the tracks did grow on me. The game itself was really good, though I still prefered MM9. It's too bad Mega Man is pretty much dead, what terrible franchise management on Capcom's part. Looking at how great Mega Man looks in the next Smash Bros, I'd be totally up for a Mega Man game by Sakurai.
author: SupraDarky

text: It's very alive. It's just called Mighty No. 9 now.

text: @NeatNit Man forget mighty number 9 megaman and zero will always be in my heart. Oh god i just shed a tear. I need my mega man back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
